alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 7:52PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun, southeastern Etowah and southwestern Cherokee Counties through 830 PM CST... At 752 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ohatchee, or 9 miles southeast of Rainbow City, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Glencoe, Ohatchee, Tennala, Neely Henry Lake, Ball Flat, Ballplay, Alexandria, Southside, Coloma, Cobb City, Knightens Crossroads, Sulphur Springs, Reaves and Wellington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
